newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for April 22.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for April 22.

text.p: All Mexican ports were open on Tuesday, the Communications and Transport Ministry (SCT) said in its 1000 local/1500 GMT daily meteorological report.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Pacific Coast, Gulf of Mexico and Caribbean.

Clear skies and maximum winds from 15 to 20 knots (29 to 38 km/16 to 22 miles per hour), with waves six to nine feet high along the northern coast. Winds less than 10 knots (19 km/11 miles per hour) and waves three to six feet high along rest of the coastline.
The ministry said an oil spill will be simulated outside Lazaro Cardenas port on Friday from 0600 local/1100 GMT to 1600 local/2100 GMT for a mile along the coast.
Tropical air in the region with maximum winds from 10 to 15 knots (19 to 28 km/11 to 16 miles per hour) and waves four to seven feet high.
Hot and partly cloudy with winds from 20 to 30 km per hour.
